compliancePoliciesGrossUpRelated.gross_up_rule: Office equipment (business use), Training (job-related) are tax exempt providing correct criteria is followed and genuine business use
Phone/internet €20/month max tax-exempt, amounts above this limit are taxable
Home office €6/day, max €1,260/year tax-exempt, amounts above limits are taxable
Wellness benefits max €600/year tax-exempt, amounts above this limit are taxable
IT equipment that is considered as company property, Office supplies that are relevant and reasonable in amount are tax exempt

Meals (outside of business travel report), Fuel, Phone Bill, Transportation to workplace, Office groceries, Other items which are not essential to carry out work activity are not tax exempt and employees should be compensated
Entertainment expenses qualify only if offered to third party as well. Entertainment expenses solely for employees of same company will not be accepted
Telephone costs can only be reimbursed tax-free at flat rate of up to 20% of invoiced amount, up to maximum of EUR 20 per month
Mobile phone usage can only be reimbursed tax-free if worker uses separate phone for personal use and can provide proof of this phone
Internet costs can be reimbursed at flat of 25% of invoice amount tax free
Reimbursement of average expenses on business behalf: Based on three month record an average percentage rate is determined on how much private cell phone is used for business purposes
Reimbursement rate €0.30 per km (standard tax-free rate for business trips with private vehicle)
KM reimbursement will be tax exempt but fuel will be taxed

Domestic: €28 for full day (24h), €14 for arrival/departure days. International: per diem rates vary per country according to government rates. Any per diem rate offered above government set rate will be fully taxable
Per diems are only tax-free for up to three months of continuous business travel in given location (3-month rule or 3-Monatsfrist). Long stay of more than three months are taxable

compliancePoliciesAdditionalInfoRelated.expense_type: Hotel, Flight, Restaurant, Office supplies, Software, Equipment, Training, Entertainment, Utilities, Professional services, Medical
compliancePoliciesAdditionalInfoRelated.additional_info_rule: Familiarize your worker on how to report their expenses through Expensify or a manual expense report (to be agreed between the worker and manager)
Mileage reimbursement requires providing a Fahrtenbuch (mileage logbook), which must include date, route, purpose, and odometer readings (a Mileage log sample is available on request)
Worker will need to share a map with the relevant route (google maps is sufficient) and complete Global People's travel report where applicable
Per diem method cannot be mixed up with actual expenses. You will need to agree with the worker on one method per business trip
If meals have been pre-arranged the meal allowance should be reduced by 20 to 40% depending on which meals were provided
If breakfast is included e.g. in the hotel fee, 20% of the flat rate will be deducted for the day. If lunch or dinner is provided by the employer, 40% of the fee will be removed
For Domestic business trips, the total allowance per day is reduced to zero when all meals (breakfast, lunch and dinner) are provided
No receipts or invoices need to be provided when using the per diem method. Receipts are not required for per diem when expensing a fixed daily allowance
Business travel expenses must be submitted using this report: Travel Expense Report.xlsx. All travel related expenses must be reported using this template
Business Trip - submit a separate report for each trip
Training expenses require the approval of the direct manager
For entertainment expense to qualify, entertainment has to have been offered to third party as well. Invoices are required to note Global People's name, address and VAT amount
Supporting documents required to ensure the flight reimbursement is processed as net: missing payment receipt/invoice as well as ticket copy
Go Global- An A1 certificate is required when travelling
